classData.comment:
/**
 * @summary Manages a tabbed interface with a header toolbar and a content body.
 *
 * This class acts as the main orchestrator for a tabbed view. It uses a flexbox layout to arrange its
 * two primary children: a `Neo.tab.header.Toolbar` for the tab buttons and a `Neo.tab.BodyContainer`.
 * The `BodyContainer` is configured with a `card` layout. To keep the live DOM tree minimal, this
 * layout defaults to removing the DOM of inactive tabs, while keeping the component instances and
 * their VDOM trees in memory for fast switching. This behavior can be changed via the `removeInactiveCards` config.
 *
 * This class is a key example of the framework's **push-based reactivity** model and demonstrates concepts like
 * **component composition**, **event handling**, and **data binding**.
 *
 * @see Neo.examples.tab.Container
 * @class Neo.tab.Container
 * @extends Neo.container.Base
 */
classData.summary:
Manages a tabbed interface with a header toolbar and a content body.

This class acts as the main orchestrator for a tabbed view. It uses a flexbox layout to arrange its
two primary children: a `Neo.tab.header.Toolbar` for the tab buttons and a `Neo.tab.BodyContainer`.
The `BodyContainer` is configured with a `card` layout. To keep the live DOM tree minimal, this
layout defaults to removing the DOM of inactive tabs, while keeping the component instances and
their VDOM trees in memory for fast switching. This behavior can be changed via the `removeInactiveCards` config.

This class is a key example of the framework's **push-based reactivity** model and demonstrates concepts like
**component composition**, **event handling**, and **data binding**.
classData.name: Container

classData.comment:
/**
     * Adds one or more tab items to the end of the container.
     * @param {Object|Object[]} item The configuration object for a new tab or an array of such objects.
     * @returns {Neo.component.Base|Neo.component.Base[]} The newly created component(s).
     */
classData.description: Adds one or more tab items to the end of the container.

params.description: The configuration object for a new tab or an array of such objects.
params.name: item

classData.name: add

classData.comment:
/**
     * Handles the logic after the `activeIndex` config has changed. It ensures that the
     * layout of the `BodyContainer` is updated to show the correct card and fires the
     * `activeIndexChange` event.
     * @param {Number|null} value The new active index.
     * @param {Number|null} oldValue The previous active index.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Handles the logic after the activeIndex config has changed. It ensures that the layout of the BodyContainer is updated to show the correct card and fires the activeIndexChange event.
classData.name: afterSetActiveIndex

classData.comment:
/**
     * Applies or removes the plain CSS class when the `plain` config changes.
     * @param {Boolean} value The new value for `plain`.
     * @param {Boolean} oldValue The old value for `plain`.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Applies or removes the plain CSS class when the plain config changes.
classData.name: afterSetPlain

classData.comment:
/**
     * Passes the `sortable` config down to the `HeaderToolbar` instance.
     * @param {Boolean} value The new value for `sortable`.
     * @param {Boolean} oldValue The old value for `sortable`.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Passes the sortable config down to the HeaderToolbar instance.
classData.name: afterSetSortable

classData.comment:
/**
     * Adjusts the container's layout and CSS classes when the tab bar position changes.
     * This method ensures that the `HeaderToolbar` is docked correctly and that the overall
     * flexbox layout direction is updated to accommodate the new position (e.g., row for left/right,
     * column for top/bottom).
     * @param {String} value The new tab bar position ('top', 'right', 'bottom', 'left').
     * @param {String} oldValue The old tab bar position.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Adjusts the container's layout and CSS classes when the tab bar position changes. This method ensures that the HeaderToolbar is docked correctly and that the overall flexbox layout direction is updated to accommodate the new position (e.g., row for left/right, column for top/bottom).
classData.name: afterSetTabBarPosition

classData.comment:
/**
     * Passes the `useActiveTabIndicator` config down to the `HeaderToolbar` and `Strip` instances.
     * @param {Boolean} value The new value for `useActiveTabIndicator`.
     * @param {Boolean} oldValue The old value for `useActiveTabIndicator`.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Passes the useActiveTabIndicator config down to the HeaderToolbar and Strip instances.
classData.name: afterSetUseActiveTabIndicator

classData.comment:
/**
     * Validates the new value for the `tabBarPosition` config.
     * @param {String} value The new value.
     * @param {String} oldValue The old value.
     * @protected
     * @returns {String} The validated value.
     */
classData.description: Validates the new value for the tabBarPosition config.
classData.name: beforeSetTabBarPosition

classData.comment:
/**
     * Overrides the base `createItems` lifecycle method to construct the specific component
     * hierarchy required for a tab container. It transforms the user-provided `items` array
     * into the three core child components: `HeaderToolbar`, `Strip`, and `BodyContainer`.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Overrides the base createItems lifecycle method to construct the specific component hierarchy required for a tab container. It transforms the user-provided items array into the three core child components: HeaderToolbar, Strip, and BodyContainer.
classData.name: createItems

classData.description: Retrieves the component instance for the currently active tab.

returns.description: The active card component or null if none is active.

classData.comment:
/**
     * Generates the appropriate flexbox layout configuration based on the current `tabBarPosition`.
     * For example, a 'top' or 'bottom' position requires a vertical layout, while 'left' or 'right'
     * requires a horizontal one.
     * @returns {Object} The flexbox layout configuration object.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Generates the appropriate flexbox layout configuration based on the current tabBarPosition. For example, a 'top' or 'bottom' position requires a vertical layout, while 'left' or 'right' requires a horizontal one.
classData.name: getLayoutConfig

classData.comment:
/**
     * Retrieves the `HeaderButton` instance for a tab at a specific index.
     * @param {Number} index The index of the tab button to retrieve.
     * @returns {Neo.tab.header.Button|null} The tab button component or null if not found.
     */
classData.description: Retrieves the HeaderButton instance for a tab at a specific index.

params.description: The index of the tab button to retrieve.
params.name: index

returns.description: The tab button component or null if not found.

classData.name: getTabAtIndex

classData.comment:
/**
     * A convenience method to get the `HeaderToolbar` instance that holds the tab buttons.
     * @returns {Neo.toolbar.Base} The header toolbar instance.
     */
classData.description: A convenience method to get the HeaderToolbar instance that holds the tab buttons.
classData.name: getTabBar

classData.comment:
/**
     * Creates the configuration object for a single tab button. It merges a default configuration
     * (including the module, index, and a click listener to change `activeIndex`) with the
     * user-provided configuration from the item's `header` property.
     * @param {Object} config The user-provided configuration from `item.header`.
     * @param {Number} index The index of this tab button.
     * @returns {Object} The merged configuration object for the tab button.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Creates the configuration object for a single tab button. It merges a default configuration (including the module, index, and a click listener to change activeIndex) with the user-provided configuration from the item's header property.

returns.description: The merged configuration object for the tab button.

classData.name: getTabButtonConfig

classData.comment:
/**
     * A convenience method to get the `Strip` instance, which is responsible for rendering
     * the active tab indicator.
     * @returns {Neo.tab.Strip} The strip instance.
     */
classData.description: A convenience method to get the Strip instance, which is responsible for rendering the active tab indicator.
classData.name: getTabStrip

classData.comment:
/**
     * Inserts one or more tab items at a specific index.
     * @param {Number} index The index at which to insert the new item(s).
     * @param {Object|Object[]} item The configuration object for a new tab or an array of such objects.
     * @param {Boolean} [silent=false] Set to true to prevent `updateTabButtons` from being called.
     * @returns {Neo.component.Base|Neo.component.Base[]} The newly created component(s).
     */
classData.description: Inserts one or more tab items at a specific index.

params.description: The index at which to insert the new item(s).
params.name: index

params.description: The configuration object for a new tab or an array of such objects.
params.name: item

params.description: Set to true to prevent updateTabButtons from being called.
params.name: silent

classData.name: insert

classData.comment:
/**
     * Moves an existing tab (both its button and its card) from one index to another.
     * This is primarily used for drag-and-drop reordering.
     * @param {Number} fromIndex The original index of the tab.
     * @param {Number} toIndex The new index for the tab.
     * @returns {Neo.component.Base} The card component that was moved.
     */
classData.description: Moves an existing tab (both its button and its card) from one index to another. This is primarily used for drag-and-drop reordering.

returns.description: The card component that was moved.

classData.name: moveTo

classData.comment:
/**
     * Overrides the base `onConstructed` lifecycle method to apply the initial flexbox layout
     * configuration after the main construction process is complete.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Overrides the base onConstructed lifecycle method to apply the initial flexbox layout configuration after the main construction process is complete.
classData.name: onConstructed

classData.comment:
/**
     * A handler that is triggered when a dynamically added tab button is mounted to the DOM.
     * If `activateInsertedTabs` is true, this method ensures that the `activeIndex` is set
     * correctly after the new tab's corresponding card is also mounted.
     * @param {String} buttonId The ID of the mounted button.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: A handler that is triggered when a dynamically added tab button is mounted to the DOM. If activateInsertedTabs is true, this method ensures that the activeIndex is set correctly after the new tab's corresponding card is also mounted.
classData.name: onTabButtonMounted

classData.comment:
/**
     * Removes a tab from the container using a reference to the card component.
     * @param {Neo.component.Base} component The card component instance to remove.
     * @param {Boolean} [destroyItem=true] Set to false to keep the component instance in memory.
     * @param {Boolean} [silent=false] Set to true to prevent `updateTabButtons` from being called.
     */
classData.description: Removes a tab from the container using a reference to the card component.

params.description: Set to false to keep the component instance in memory.
params.name: destroyItem

params.description: Set to true to prevent updateTabButtons from being called.
params.name: silent

classData.name: remove

classData.comment:
/**
     * Removes a tab from the container at a specific index.
     * @param {Number} index The index of the tab to remove.
     * @param {Boolean} [destroyItem=true] Set to false to keep the component instance in memory.
     * @param {Boolean} [silent=false] Set to true to prevent `updateTabButtons` from being called.
     */
classData.description: Removes a tab from the container at a specific index.

params.description: The index of the tab to remove.
params.name: index

params.description: Set to false to keep the component instance in memory.
params.name: destroyItem

params.description: Set to true to prevent updateTabButtons from being called.
params.name: silent

classData.name: removeAt

classData.comment:
/**
     * Synchronizes the `pressed` state of all tab buttons with the container's `activeIndex`.
     * This ensures that only the button corresponding to the active tab appears pressed.
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Synchronizes the pressed state of all tab buttons with the container's activeIndex. This ensures that only the button corresponding to the active tab appears pressed.
classData.name: updateTabButtons
